meanings.definition: To make equal in value or power.
meanings.sent1: She coequates her two favorite toys by playing with them equally.
meanings.sent2: The teacher coequated the scores of the students to ensure fairness.
meanings.sent3: The chef coequated the ingredients in the recipe, creating a perfectly balanced dish.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to his work coequates to his passion for success.
meanings.sent5: The scales of justice coequate the rights of all individuals.

meanings.definition: To bring into a state of equilibrium or balance.
meanings.sent1: The therapist coequates the conflicting emotions of her patients to help them find peace.
meanings.sent2: Adding more weight to one side of the scale coequates the two sides.
meanings.sent3: The gymnast coequated her movements, gracefully balancing on the beam.
meanings.sent4: The negotiation coequated the demands of both parties, reaching a fair compromise.
meanings.sent5: The tightrope walker coequates his body to maintain stability while crossing.
